head.supplied: Melbourne bot. Garden ¶ 21/1/67 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ Having received no answer to my last letter respecting the invasion of cattle into my northern reserve from the adjoining municipal ground, ¶ I have the hon...

div.p: No. 2419, unit 732, VPRS 3181/P Town Clerk's file series 1, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Having received no answer to my last letter respecting the invasion of cattle into my northern reserve from the adjoining municipal ground,
See M to E. FitzGibbon, 7 January 1867. I have the honor to request, that you will kindly inform me of the measures to be adopted by the City Council to bring these molestations to a cessation. I feel convinced that so enlightened a council does not wish that difficulties through their disposal of municipal ground should arise in carrying on my planting operations, but in the absence of all answer to my applications I am unable to take now the necessary measures for the preparatory autumnal work
M's letter was referred to the Melbourne City Council's Health Committee; for the decisions reached, see E. FitzGibbon to M, 11 February 1867.

div.p: I have the honor to be,
